title: Calories in 4 Scrambled Eggs
meta_description: Discover calories in 4 scrambled eggs, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Large eggs (~50 g each), scrambled with 1 tsp butter total, no milk, cheese, or added salt.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, added ingredients like milk or oil, cooking method, and portioning. Check recipes or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: Four large scrambled eggs offer ~364 kcal and ~24 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one scrambled egg?
faqs.a: About 91 kcal for one large scrambled egg with minimal butter.

faqs.q: What is the protein in 4 scrambled eggs?
Do scrambled eggs have a lot of fat?
faqs.a: Yes, ~28 g total fat for 4 eggs, mostly from yolks and added butter.

faqs.q: How does adding milk affect calories in scrambled eggs?
faqs.a: Adds ~10 kcal per tbsp per 2 eggs, plus minor carbs.

faqs.q: Are scrambled eggs higher in calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added fats; boiled are ~78 kcal per egg vs. 91 for scrambled.
